tweet: PREPARE IN ADVANCE: The @SCDNR Law Enforcement Division will be holding courtesy boat inspections at public boat landings across the state. Full information and locations:  http://www.dnr.sc.gov/ne …/2019/jun/jun25_boatinspections.php pic.twitter.com/GM05NKapBU

Additionally, I am grateful to the SC General Assembly for passing the “Samantha L. Josephson Ridesharing Safety Act” specifying that ride-share drivers must display license plate numbers on the front of their cars. #samistrong #whatsmyname #samislaw
S-A-M-I: Stop, Ask, Match, Inform. #whatsmyname #samistrong #samislaw pic.twitter.com/uwGU58VKvW

Make sure your loved ones are alert to their surroundings, ensure the car they are entering is the correct ride-share vehicle, ask the driver to identify them by name, and tell friends to track their ride. #samislaw #whatsmyname

I’m grateful to join @SenatorCardin and @RepChrisSmith in supporting #SamisLaw which establishes needed protections for ride-sharing customers across the country.

Remind your loved ones to remember Sami before entering a rideshare. #samistrong #whatsmyname

In March, @UofSC student Samantha Josephson was kidnapped and murdered by a man pretending to be an Uber driver. My heart is broken for Sami, her family, loved ones, and members of the Gamecock Community. #whatsmyname #samistrong

Today’s designation by @USTreasury is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the UN in Syria. The U.S. must play a leading role in humanitarian efforts, but we must make sure that our good intentions don’t end up making life better for the criminal Assad regime.

The UN spends over $26,000 a night at the Four Seasons Damascus, owned by Mr. Foz. That’s nearly $10 million a year. How much U.S. taxpayer money sent to the UN in Syria ends up in the Assad regime's coffers?

Grateful that @USTreasury is finally going after Samer Foz & his operations in #Syria that directly underwrite the murderous Assad regime’s crimes against the Syrian people. https://twitter.com/USTreasury/status/1138491908769165312 …
Thank you for all of your tireless work to raise awareness & your great partnership with our office!

Did you know that 313,000 caregivers in SC are providing 352 million hours of unpaid care to loved ones with Alzheimer’s or other dementias? @alzassociation #ENDALZ #EndAlzheimers pic.twitter.com/DYSxw3UDsP

.@CDCgov estimates that by 2030, heart disease will cost the country $1 billion a day in medical costs & lost productivity. The #SouthAsianHeartHealthAct is a real opportunity to cut costs and invest in communities disproportionately affected by cardiovascular disease. pic.twitter.com/kbIHCp4xUC

The South Asian community is disproportionately affected by heart disease, our nation's leading cause of death. I'm proud to support the bipartisan #SouthAsianHeartHealthAct, which funds critical research for heart disease conditions like heart attacks and strokes.
